cells.data:
## Purpose

I gel purfied the three highest temperatures from PCR CM004 of each species and yielded very low DNA concentrations. I think I lost too much DNA to run a successful ligation then gel purification of the material (after ligation).  This PCR is going to make more of the ES2 insert so I can properly run the digest and further gel purfy for ligation. 

## DNA 

Used the DNA the was extracted August 15, 2016.

## Samples

Primers: `Dbir_ES2_F1_cm` and `Dbir_ES2_R1_cm`
Note: I think I used D. birchii ES2 PCR product from PCR CM004 as the DNA in these three so I did it again (10, 11, and 12), not sure why they all didn't work though.

1.)  D. birchii 
2.)  D. birchii 
3.)  D. birchii

Primers: `Dboc_ES2_F1_cm` and `Dbir_ES2_R1_cm`
4.)  D. bocki
5.)  D. bocki
6.)  D. bocki

Primers: `Druf_ES2_F1_cm` and `Dbir_ES2_R1_cm`
7.)  D. jambulina
8.)  D. jambulina
9.)  D. jambulina

Primers: `Dbir_ES2_F1_cm` and `Dbir_ES2_R1_cm`
10.) D. birchii
11.) D. birchii
12.) D. birchii


## Program

| step | temp       |  time  |
|------|------------|--------|
| 1    | 95         | 30 sec |
| 2    | 95         | 15 sec |
| 3    | 66         | 1 min  |
| 4    | 72         | 2 min  |
| 5    | 72         | 1 min  |
| 6    | 4          | hold   |

## Results

![Screen Shot 2016-08-18 at 1.45.28 PM.png](quiver-image-url/8FDED95F8193D631C7A3B4DB7BAB2852.png)


## Conclusions and Next

Looks like they all work well at 66 c, with the exception of D. birchii. I am going to pool all (except the first three) and purify all three of each species together to hopefully yield enough DNA. Purification using DNA Clean and Concentrator by Zymo Reasearch.
